noun.description: A person who is among the first to explore or settle a new country or area.

verb.description: Develop or be the first to use or apply (a new method, area of knowledge, or activity)
examples: he has pioneered a number of innovative techniques

proper noun.description: A series of American space probes launched between 1958 and 1973, two of which provided the first clear pictures of Jupiter and Saturn (1973–79).

origin: Early 16th century (as a military term denoting a member of the infantry): from French pionnier foot soldier, pioneer, Old French paonier, from paon, from Latin pedo, pedon- (see pawn).
